Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] FindBugs Community Review of Heritrix
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=254719850; y=TFTSGhFdhuTuq_fuvQ50BG4sCC-1fTHOPtod0twFgSCp

hi Nat,

thanks so much for your invitation, and for including Heritrix
in your review. we're always interested in improving the quality
of the code, and supporting the community.

i've run FindBugs locally, and opened an initial issue to
address the high priority bugs reported:

https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1758

this issue includes high priority bugs found in the latest
builds of H1 (Heritrix 1.14.3) as well as H3 (Heritrix 3.0.0) as
output by FindBugs with the -emacs option. we'll need to learn
how to tell FindBugs how to find "missing classes needed for
analysis", and how to exclude "bugs" which we want ignored.

we would also like to consider including FindBugs in our
continuous integration (auto-build) process, so i've opened an
issue for that as well:

https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1757

this may be further off, as we plan to consolidate auto-builds
for H1 (CruiseControl) and H3 (Continuum) into a single system.

i really like the FindBugs Eclipse plugin, but don't see a way
to get "-emacs"-like output from it, and it doesn't look like
annotations (in the Bug User Annotations view) can be uploaded
to the cloud from the plugin.

when i open the Web Start client, it says "not signed in", but
the Comunity Review page says a seperate browser window will
open to login with OpenId. is there another way to login to the
review?

which version of Heritrix was analyzed to produce the bugs in
the FindBugs Cloud? is there a way to see the options that were
used to produce the cloud report for a particular project?

it would be nice to reconcile the cloud bugs with the bugs i
find with a local client, so we can track them together.
otherwise, i'll need to open a seperate issue simply to provide
feedback to the cloud for Community Review. do you have another
recommendation?


/steve@...


On 4/13/10 11:49 AM, Nat Ayewah wrote:
>
>
> Hello,
>
> I am a PhD student working with the FindBugs project, at the University
> of Maryland. FindBugs <http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/> is a popular
> open source static analysis tool that can analyze Java software and
> identify bugs. We recently analyzed *Heritrix*, and identified about 42
> warnings that might be of interest to the project. You can launch an
> instance of FindBugs and evaluate each warning using this link (requires
> Java): http://findbugs.cs.umd.edu/cloud/heritrix.jnlp (You may also
> comment on any warning by signing into a Google, Yahoo or OpenID account)
>
> FindBugs has recently started a community review of several open source
> projects. This is similar to a recently completed review
> <http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/> at Google in which almost 300
> engineers reviewed thousands of issues, fixing many of them. I would
> like to invite you all to participate in the review for Heritrix, and
> other open source projects. During the review, you are able to comment
> on each warning and evaluate it as "Must Fix", "Mostly Harmless", "Not a
> Bug" and other classifications. We are particularly interested in
> learning if any warnings are causing problems in production.
>
> The list of projects currently included in our review is at
> http://findbugs.cs.umd.edu/cloud/
>
> Thanks in advance for your consideration.
>
> Kind regards,
>
> Nat Ayewah
> PhD candidate, University of Maryland
> http://www.cs.umd.edu/~ayewah
> ayewah@...
